1.description: This command returns a list of all domains that are connected to a specific domain addon
1.availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: QueryDomainAddonList
The addon class
Filter by a specific addon ID. You can specify several addon IDs separated by a '/'. If no addon ID is specified all addon IDs of the addon class will be taken
Filter by a specific domain repository
Filter by a specific domain
Filter by domain owner's name
Filter by the status of the domain addon
Set to 1 to generate additional statistics
Index of the first entry to be returned
Max. number of entries to be returned. The system has a default value for performance purposes

The parameter by which the output will be sorted. Must be one of the following: CREATEDDATECREATEDDATE, CREATEDDATEDESC, EXPIRATIONDATE, EXPIRATIONDATEDESC, STATUS, STATUSDESC, DOMAIN, DOMAINDESC, ADDONID, ADDONIDDESC
The minimal date when the addon was added for the respective domain
The maximal date when the addon was added for the respective domain

2.description: This command queries a list of domain addon log entries.
2.availability: All users have access to this command. This command only returns log entries for domain addons which the executing user owns.

paramaters.Definition: QueryDomainAddonLog
Addon class
Filter by a specific addon ID. You can specify several addon IDs separated by a '/'. If no addon ID is specified all addon IDs of the addon class will be taken
Filter by a specific domain repository. You can specify several repositories separated by a '/'.
Filter by a specific domain name
Filter by a specific action.  Must be one of the following:  ACTIVATE, ADD_BLACKLIST, CONFIRM, UNCONFIRM, CREATE, UNCREATE, DEACTIVATE, DEL_BLACKLIST, CANCEL, DELETE, EXPIRE, PENDING, RENEW, COMMENT
Index of the first entry to be returned
Max. number of entries to be returned. The system has a default value for performance purposes

The parameter by which the output will be sorted. Must be one of the following:  CREATEDDATE, CREATEDDATEDESC, LOGDATE, LOGDATEDESC, OPERATIONTYPE, OPERATIONTYPEDESC, STATUS, STATUSDESC, DOMAIN, DOMAINDESC
Minimal date of the log entry
Maximal date of the log entry
The minimal age of the addon. Value has to be a dedicated number of months (e.g. 3M) or years (e.g. 1Y)
The maximal age of the addon. Value has to be a dedicated number of months (e.g. 3M) or years (e.g. 1Y)
If set to 1 additional statistics will be displayed
You can specify additional properties to be returned. Only allowed value is PRICE

78.description: Set the renewal mode of a single domain. With this command you can choose what is going to happen with the domain after the registration expiration date.
78.availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: SetDomainRenewalMode
Domain Name

DEFAULT: Set the renewal mode of the domain according to the default renewal mode specified in the account settings.AUTORENEW: When the RegistrationPeriod for a domain expires, the domain is automatically renewed (on FinalizationDate) and the RegistrationPeriod is extended by the length of the RenewalPeriod for a particular domain (normally 1 year). AUTOEXPIRE: Domain is deleted at the end of the RegistrationPeriod (on FailureDate), or is pushed to the registry for self management if the respective registry offers such functionality.AUTODELETE: Domain is deleted at the end of the RegistrationPeriod (on FailureDate).AUTORENEWMONTHLY: Behaves like AUTORENEW, but on a monthly cycle (currently only available for .DE domains).
paramaters.Type: DEFAULT, AUTORENEW, AUTOEXPIRE, AUTODELETE or AUTORENEWMONTHLY

84.availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: TransferDomain
Domain Name
Order action:CREATE - create a transfer orderREPLACE - replace a transfer orderUPDATE - update a transfer order

Application order ID. Will only be taken into consideration if parameter ORDER is set to REPLACE or UPDATE. If parameter is not stated and order is REPLACE or UPDATE an auto detection will be carried out to detect the right order
Auth-Info code, required for some TLDs.

Action, may be one of the following (default value is REQUEST):REQUEST: Request a transfer-in from another registrarUSERTRANSFER: Request a usertransfer (internal transfer)CANCEL: Cancel a requested transfer-inAPPROVE: Approve a requested transfer-outDENY: Deny a requested transfer-out

paramaters.Definition: Domain name and authorization code provided as one parameter; must have the form "DOMAIN AUTH"
The class of the domain name if it is a premium domain

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. This parameter specifies the language of this email. If the desired language is not available, the English version of the email will be sent. Currently the following languages are available for gTLD transfers:en_US: Englishde_DE: German and Englishsv_SE: Swedish and English The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/emaillanguage".

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. This email can include a confirmation link allowing the recipient to confirm the domain transfer. The URL for this link can be specified by this parameter. You can use the following place holders which will be replaced accordingly:{ACTION}: transfer operation{DOMAIN}: domain that is supposed to get transferred{TRIGGER}: trigger code through which the email recipient is validated{LANGUAGE}: the language of the confirmation page (Same value as EMAILLANGUAGE)The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/url"If this parameter is not specified and the respective environment key does not exists for the user account the following URL will be taken which leads to our whitelabel confirmation page: http://icann-transfers.info/?domain={DOMAIN}&action={ACTION}&trigger={TRIGGER}&form_language={LANGUAGE}

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. This email can contain a link to the Terms and Conditions of the new registrar/reseller. The link to those Terms and Conditions can be specified with this parameter. The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/tac"

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. Since an email with a foreign sender address is much more likely to be considered spam, only the reply-to address of the email may be specified using this parameter. The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/emailsender"

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. The subject of this email can be specified by this parameter. It may contain the following place holders which will be replaced accordingly:{ACTION}: transfer operation{DOMAIN}: domain that is supposed to get transferred{TRIGGER}: trigger code through which the email recipient is validatedThe default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/emailsubject"

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. When this parameter is used, the system checks if the provided email address matches one of those email addresses to which the email will be sent. If it does not, the command will fail.

114.description: Add an accounting into the accounting list of a subuser's account.

130.description: Query one or more environment values.
130.availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: GetEnvironment
One or more keys of the environment names (prefixes of the name), e.g. _system/defaults
One or more environment names (in the context of the environment key), e.g. nameserver, renewalmode or language

Limit the number of parent user lookups to a dedicated number of levels. A value of e.g. 1 will only consider the direct parent user. This is e.g. useful if branding related environment values should have a default setting (defined by the direct parent user). In the case that a respective environment has not been set by the direct parant user the setting of his parent user will not be revealed
One or more IDs of subuser account. If SUBUSER[X] is set for a dedicated environment query then USEPARENT[X] must not be requested for the same query

Query environment values of parent users unless the environment is found. Starting from the user itself the environment value of the respective parent user will be searched as long as the evironment is not found. This way parent users can define a default setting which may be overwritten by there users and subusers. Environment settings of the parent user that have a PARENT_ONLY_READABLE flag set can not be queried. It is possible to restrict the number of searched levels with the LEVEL[0..N] parameter. If USEPARENT[X] is set for a dedicated environment query it must not be combined with SUBUSER[X]

The role user ID

Description text to describe e.g. the position or rights of a user within a company

A list of API commands which execution the role user is either denied or granted. Must be stated in the following syntax: API command, followed by squared or round brackets, a colon, and ALLOW or DENY. Example: RenewDomain():DENY denies the execution of RenewDomain commands for the role user.You can also allow or deny only the execution of commands with certain parameters via wildcards. Squared brackets work for white- and blacklisting with any amount of parameters.Round brackets do only work for at maximum one parameter and enforce the use of a given parameter in the command.
